bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Henry W. Woltman, March 11, 1938

div1.p: Hench solicits Woltman's help in reviewing Andrus' medical condition.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Henry W. Woltman, March 11, 1938
div1.p:
You remember that I spoke to you a few weeks ago about Mr.
John R. Kissinger, the first volunteer to receive mosquito bites from
Walter Reed, and who got the yellow fever in Havana. He later developed
myelitis for thirteen years. This patient, Mr. Andrus, was also one of
the yellow fever volunteers, and more recently has developed apparently
a myelitis. I don't know what you can write his son, but I would appreciate
your looking over this letter and writing him something. I am writing up
the history of the yellow fever experiments and have been therefore
corresponding with the survivors. Unfortunately, some of them have been
asking for a little medical advice on the side and as I want to keep them
friendly, I am taking the liberty of bothering you with it.
